text: today I'm making something that's really
simple with very few ingredients it's a
bit of a variation on macaroni and
cheese but instead of using like elbow
macaroni I'm using tortellini
it's tortellini with bacon and it's
baked together until it's a bubbly and
delicious so start off by dicing up an
onion now this is kind of a biggish
onion the recipe calls for a small so
I'm only going to use 1/2 and then it
says to dice it medium but I always
taste everything really small especially
when I'm making bechamel so if you can
mince it that's what I would do you'll
also need 1 clove of garlic if you
wanted to use your garlic press here
that would be good I often do I already
have 4 slices of bacon cooking and they
seem like they're just about ready so
I'm going to take them out of the pan
bacon is crisp top and there's some fat
in the pan which I'm going to leave in
there because I want to cook my onion
and garlic right in that pan to your pan
add the onion and garlic and cook that
until the onion is translucent I like to
season my onions starts pulling the
moisture out the salt in any case and
then pepper obviously said flavor so a
little salt and pepper another cool
thing about this recipe is that the
tortellini cook right in the sauce it
only takes a few minutes because
tortellini are basically a fresh pasta
add a tablespoon of flour this will
thicken the sauce slightly then stir it
in 2 cups of milk
I'm going to do a little bit and then
I'll do a little bit more this will get
up all the flower and then the rest in
order to fully activate the flower and
let it actually thicken the milk the
mixture needs to come to a boil and then
you can add your tortellini directly
into this pan now that it's come to a
simmer add the tortellini this is a
pound of tortellini and then you just
simmer your tortellini right in the
sauce it needs to simmer for about four
minutes before you put the bacon back in
and then add some cheese so it's really
thickened up and the tortellini are
cooked through
you can add cheese this is a half a cup
of adding a quarter into the sauce and
then a quarter can go on top the bacon
can also go in you could sprinkle the
bacon on top if you wanted to stay super
crispy or mix it in it's up to you don't
forget to have a little bit you deserve
it then just pour it into a 2 quart
baking dish and have your oven preheated
to broiler scrape out all the goodness
into the pan I'll leave it behind then
sprinkle the rest of the cheese another
quarter cup over the top and then just
pop this into the broiler about 3 to 5
minutes depending on the heat of your
broiler that's it really fast you can
make this ahead if you want to and then
just pop it under the broiler in the
oven to reheat for a little while but
it's so fast I don't even really feel
like you need to right isn't that the
best it's a great cozy winter weeknight
meal from me to you mmm I'm not going to
stop I'm going to eat this whole bowl
